attributes.action: Uk Gov to prioritise aid to the amazon forest fires being it is a global issue
attributes.additional_details: It is also crucial to note that the amazon rainforest is the worlds largest and to date is home to a few thousand indigenous people, 2.5 million insect species, tens of thousands of plants & some 2,000 birds & mammals. 40,000 plant species, 2,200 fishes, 1,294 birds, 427 mammals, 428 amphibians and 378 reptiles have been scientifically classified. We as the public need to increase pressure on the government & those in power to provide aid in all possible ways for the sake of all living beings.
attributes.background: The amazon forest is responsible for 20% of the worlds oxygen. This alone is enough reason for all countries and world leaders to get involved to provide aid. This is not a national issue, this is a global disaster for which we will all experience unimaginable consequences for.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.
The UK Government has already made aid available, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pm-steps-up-uk-efforts-to-protect-the-amazon-rainforest

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do, for example a petition calling for an increase in the amount of aid.
